page.title: 04THE TOWN QUAY
page.content: This is to the west of the abbey ruins. It is on the River Roding, upriver from Barking Creek. Barking used to be an important fishing town. The fishing boats used to unload at the quay. One of the best known fishing fleets was the {Short Blue {Fleet}which was owned by the {Hewitt {family.}It was once the largest in the world. The quay was also used commercially and there is still an old warehouse next to the bridge over the river. The whole area is now derelict, though the basin is sometimes used by canoe clubs.
